Reviews.Title: “Great location, otherwise quite plain”
Reviews.Author: ChantalNB
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, so close to San Marco. Our bed was clean and comfortable, but the carpet and washroom could have been cleaner. Breakfast was bread and croissant with cocoa or coffee essentially. Given the good price and location, overall it was passable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: WritingKiwi
Reviews.Content: Basically arrived in the pouring rain off the airport boat at the San Marco pier & this was the first hotel was came across. 90 euro per night was steep for us however were expecting expensive anyway & did not want to trail around Venice in the rain looking for other places. Clean, tidy, quiet & warm - average breakfast compared to rest of Italy however it filled the gap. Very central & close to get boat to train station when we left. Reception men were very serious however no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wonderkathy
Reviews.Content: The only plus for this hotel is its location. The service from the front lobby staff was very poor. They were most unhelpful, in fact rude when I referred to a sent email asking for a specific room within this hotel. One would think that for 300 Euro a night and 3 weeks notice this small request could be accomodated. But no. I stayed 3 nights. The room was clean, upstairs fronting the street. The bathroom facilites were not of a 3 star hotel. Antiquated hair dryer a trickling shower that you had to hold. Then there was breakfast. One cup of coffee was all that was allowed. No cereal just a yoghurt and croissants. The pillows were like hardened clay. We were there early September 2011 and the days were hot but the air conditioner did work.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Casenova”
Reviews.Author: horwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and found the location of the hotel very convenient for all parts of Venice. Venice is very different from any other european experience I have had, it was funny watching so many people trailing through the city towing suitcases, as there are no taxis or buses to the hotel door. This hotel is very convenient for the water taxis and vaporetto, a short walk from St Mark's Gardens and behind Harry's Bar. Our room was good for a short stay, the room was clean and well decorated and on the 4th Floor, the rooms were quiet internally but noisy if you have the windows open, please remember that this is a city of no vehicles so the only way is on foot and people walk though this area until about 1am, we were no troubled by the talking. The bathroom was ok, the taps etc could have done with a good polish, although this was carried out before the 4th night, probably a different housekeeper. Breakfast was very basic, tea and coffee, fruit juice (no choice), yoghurt and a basket of rolls, jam, butter and one cheese portion (dairylea); The front desk was efficient but no warmth to the welcome. I would give the restauraunts right opposite the door a miss, cheap and nasty, not just our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing good is Location”
Reviews.Author: JMLalonde
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. Rooms and bathroom need heavy housecleaning. Noisy rooms. Also found some very small insects n the bathroom. Front staff fairly friendly. Breakfast good for european standards but staff cold.

Reviews.Title: “Location is really the only saving grace...”
Reviews.Author: allyphant
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest and say that I chose the hotel solely for its location. I was arriving in late from Venice and being a first time vacationer to this city, I did not want to have to travel too far to get to my hotel. It is really a stone's throw away from the alilaguna station. I saw that the reviews on tripadvisor were not great but decided to put convenience over comfort. I think I really regretted that choice. The lobby of the hotel is rather charming, the helpfulness of the staff was mixed. The hotel room was seriously a blast from the past with all the furniture you can imagine from your grandmother's living room. The toilet was decently clean but I had to flush it a few times before anything would go down. I got stuck in the toilet and had to ram my way out by pushing my shoulder against the door. The sofa in the room had mysterious blotches of stuff and crustiness at some corners. It's really noisy until early in the morning because the hotel is really close San Marco Square, I can't really blame the hotel for this but if you are a light sleeper, this hotel is not an option for you. Some might love the charm of this hotel because it is probably representative of the era in which it was built, but unfortunately, my husband and I are not people who enjoy this kind of charm. That being said, the one redeeming thing is that you are right next to the square, all the famous brand name stores are right downstairs, we conveniently walked to the Rialto bridge area from the hotel as well. The pasta joint across the street was decent, serving up more american type pasta, but satisfying nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room, not worth the location”
Reviews.Author: webonline
Reviews.Content: More like a backpacker hostel. Noisy rooms and visitors banging the main entrance door throughout the night. No staff at night so couldn't deal with this. Room was not clean as expected. There are better hotel for same price nearby. Only good point is freshly prepared breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable in high tourist area”
Reviews.Author: DizzyD5
Reviews.Content: This was a perfectly nice hotel to stay for two nights while meeting up with a friend. Our room was spacious and the bathroom was very clean (although the shower nozzle was broken). The front desk staff was helpful with restaurants and directions, and it's easy to get to the vaparetto and the water taxi to the airport. Venice is a beautiful city with wonderful places to explore. The next time I'm in Venice I will probably stay in a much less touristy location to avoid the crowds and the kitchy shops.

Reviews.Title: “YES, YOU WILL COME BACK HERE FOR SURE”
Reviews.Author: mbutterfly1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the Winter of 2010 and although rooms are tiny (pretty though with stylish furniture) you won't regret location. You'll have three minutes walk from Piazza San Marco where you can spend the whole day! Service very nice, free access to the Internet and small breakfast in the morning. It is not our favorite hotel in Venice but if you could not find anything else we would stay here again --- price is incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value even considering the location.”
Reviews.Author: Katlowry
Reviews.Content: My group stayed here in May and the staff was not very friendly. While the location is really convenient the rooms at night were very noisy and needed a thorough scrubbing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Camel123
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to be staying at Ca`del Campo Hotel,but when i arrived, they said there was water damage and i could not stay,so they had booked me into this one. Single room was tiny and dark, large newly decorated bathroom. The view looked onto a narrow dark street, good thing was there was no noise at all. Bed was rock hard. Breakfast was not very good, a ilttle basket with tiny little roll,croissant,a yogurt jams etc. Good points the staff were very helpfull, and the location was excellent, literally out of hotel,turn left, left at the end by Guetta store, straight on 1 min and you are in St Marks Square.(3 minute walk max). Free use of laptop with internet. I know you dont spend much time in your room,but i wanted a view of a little canal or a quaint street,as i would have got with my original hotel. If location is everything for you, perhaps worth considering, although im sure there are others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kira812
Reviews.Content: After a long flight to Venice from Chicago, I was excited to arrive at this charming hotel. Its pretty much what I pictured from the website. I was expecting to get a single room w/a single bed, but was given a double. The room was small, but its what I expected for Europe. The room was clean, bathroom remodeled new. Bed extremely comfortable (as all of the places I stayed in Italy). The location was perfect! its a 5 minute walk to San Marco Square. Dont expect to sleep peacefully here though. My room faced a bustling street which constantly had tourists walking/talking/laughing. I could hear everything even w/the windows closed! It didnt bother me, but if you want peace and quite, it may not be the place. The breakfast area was nice, but not much of a breakfest. Only a bread basket, and unlimited cafe's etc. It didnt bother me, since I liked to try other places. Tons of cafes, stores, shopping all near by with the attractions. Hotel staff was ok, not overly friendly. free internet computer is set up in lobby and you can have password for wireless in your room as well. I would stay here again for the location and the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location worst Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: asm_9
Reviews.Content: Location was the best thing a few meters from St Mark Square. No value for money in terms of service. Breakfast was non-existant with yogurt, juice, toast, butter, jam & coffee/tea - no milk - she grunted & screamed in Italian when we asked for milk to go with tea/coffee. That is not wht you expect when you have paid 150Euro/night.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about this place is the location!”
Reviews.Author: annina79York
Reviews.Content: For what we paid here, the only recommendation for this hotel is its location - right next to the Piazza San Marco; the best location possible. otherwise, this hotel was down-right unfriendly; rooms were terrible. We had a room on the 4th floor where any time someone walked over us the room shook with the sound of broken glass; something is structurally wrong. Breakfast is a shabby, dreary affair. After having been at 4 other hotels before this one, we were disappointed to find that instead of a greacious buffet, we were served at our tables, each table gets a basket of 2 hard rolls and 2 croissants, along with coffee and juice. It was simply a shock to be paying so much more for this hotel and getting so much less. The bar in the room had barely anything in it. The whole place lacked charm and it certainly felt as if the owners were squeezing you for everything and giving very little in return. I would definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome find”
Reviews.Author: S123cutie
Reviews.Content: Coming from New York City, my slightly snobby friends and I are very critical of hotels. This hotel was a hit. St. Mark's square (which houses almost every attraction in Venice) is 1.5 blocks away. This was actually the closest hotel to the square that we saw. Great price, very clean--- very nice bathroom. A/C works well. Very cozy--- liked this hotel a lot--- would def recommend to anyone going to Venice, and would stay there again without hesitation. Not a 5 star (by the way some of the 3 stars are better than the 5 stars in Rome)--- but a great hotel in a great location--- highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel, Ok Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaBoudreau
Reviews.Content: Overall, very good experience. Could not be in a better location. Rooms were ok. The name on the hotel is actually the Casa Nova, not the Casanova.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: journalistwanderer
Reviews.Content: First of all, anyone who goes to Venice and spends most of their time in their hotel room is insane. GET OUT and enjoy one of the most beautiful places on Earth! That said, location is extremely important when visiting Venice - it's a city on water, full of twists and turns, and extremely easy to get lost! Hotel Casanova is in the middle of EVERYTHING! It's right off the area where the vaporetto drops you off (if you're traveling by train that's very helpful!) It's exactly where you'd want to start your walking tour. It's a block from San Marco Square which is the heart of the entire city. The cathedral is there, Harry's Bar is a short walk away... and the doge's palace isn't far either. The hotel isn't fancy - it's old and there's isn't air conditioning except during the hottest nights. Our shower was tiny and the room was a bit dusty, but we didn't care as we were only there to sleep. Our breakfast of a croissant with marmalade, Nutella, and fruit was lovely. Great coffee, too.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: margo_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a quiet street in a peaceful residential neighborhood, just a few blocks from the vaporetto stop. The owners were gracious and friendly; our room was clean and comfortable. What stands about the Hotel Casanova, for our tastes, is its location on the Lido. As others have mentioned, the 15-20 minute boat ride between Venice and the Lido was a pleasant way to unwind from the touring activity and crowds in Venice. One of the highlights of our stay in Venice was attending the Vivaldi concert in a beautiful historic church, San Vitale, at the north end of the Accademia bridge. We learned of the concert from literature in the lobby of the Casanova Hotel. Venice was crowded in September, but we managed quite easily to escape the crowds. For instance, we spent a leisurely and quiet afternoon exploring the small island where the San Giorgio Maggior church is located, going up in the bell tower for wonderful views, and sitting in the piazza in front of the church at water's edge, sketching the view of St. Mark's across the canal. Yes, we gave up seeing some important interiors and art, as the price for enjoying the beauty and magic of Venice at a comfortable pace.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: sunfanAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dirty. In one corner of our room the build up of dirt and dust was disgusting. The noise level from the street/ally behind us was unbearable until 2 am. We did not sleep either of the 2 nights spent here. The night desk person was ok but the day guy could not be bothered. The breakfast was barely average ( I could eat the yogurt.) I was furious at my travel agent for booking us here. It made Venice a not pleasant experience after staying in nice hotels in Rome and Florence. Do not stay here. It is also dark and depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: toptopcat
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of setbacks before arriving at our hotel. I must admit that Roberto was an excellant host and showed much concern when we arrived somewhat late (due to incorrect directions from the railway station ). We were shown to our room which was a welcome site. It was very clean, modern and pleasant. Little additions such as the welcome Champaigne was a great touch. The breakfast was in the little cafe adjacent to the hotel and this again was very good - simple breakfast but adequate although maybe a choice of juices etc., could be made. Roberto was also very keen to see how we perceived everything and wasn't afraid to take some constructive criticism. One point that we didn't mention to Roberto, the room we stayed in although very good wasn't very 'soundproofed' and we could hear some conversations from adjoining rooms. If this can be remedied, this would have to be one of the best hotels we stayed in during our stay in Italy. Good on you Roberto and your lovely wife who we only met on the last day. We will recommend your hotel to our friends who wish to travel to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Cheap and Definately Not Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: applesrbest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casanova Hotel on our recent trip to Venice. I had booked the Hotel Bonvecchiati but when we arrived we found that they had made an error with our booking and therefore had no room for us. We asked them to find us suitable accommodation and an hour later they recommended that we stay at this hotel for the night as that was all there was available. We arrived at the hotel at midnight and booked in. The room was filthy... there was litter and dirt all over the carpet. Parts of the carpet hadnt seen a hoover in what must have been months. The walls were dirty and there was mould and grime on the seals of the shower screen. The air conditioning unit sounded ill so we turned it off. It had to be put back on again as the room smelt so bad. Yes it may be in a convenient location but in our opinion it was not worth the money. We cannot comment on the staff as we only met one and he was fine . We cannot comment either on the breakfast as when we awoke we just wanted to get out of the hotel. We eventually got our room in the Bonvecchiati which was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: playgoer2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the 3* Hotel Casanova (not to be confused with Villa Casanova out on the Lido) in early March and found it very satisfactory. Our 4th-floor room was large, pleasant if a little plain, and quiet despite facing the narrow street. Amenities included minibar,safe, heated towel bars. The hotel has an elevator and main-floor breakfast room (no stairs to climb). Best of all, the location on Fressaria is just steps from St.Mark's Square and less than 5 minutes' walk from the airport water bus and vaparetto stops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel. Staff, especially Stefano, was very friendly and pleasant. Our double room was spacious for Venice standards with a large bathroom. The breakfast was OK and typical of European hotels. The location was the best part of this hotel, right next to Piazza San Marco and convenient to other main site seeing locations. The hotel provides a free water taxi ride to Murano, although, you have to sit through a rather long marketing presentation by the factory they take you to. The only thing I did not like about the hotel was the noise from the street under our window. And that was our choice since Stefano offered other rooms that were not facing the street. However, they were smaller and not as nice as this one. Overall, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: happy2bWelsh
Reviews.Content: 100 mtrs from st marks square and Harrys bar. restaurants and shops 10 mtrs. Very friendly multi lingual staff. Our 4th visit , need we say more.

HotelInfo.Name: Casanova Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 1284 | Frezzaria 1284, 30124 Venice, Italy
